com.foreach.across.modules.entity.views.processors.support

Class EntityViewProcessorRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.foreach.across.modules.entity.views.processors.support.EntityViewProcessorRegistry
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TransactionalEntityViewProcessorRegistry

    public class EntityViewProcessorRegistry
extends Object
    Represents a collection of EntityViewProcessors, where every processor has a unique name and optionally an order specified. When dispatching a consumer to the processors, all matching processors will be called in order.

    The default order for a processor will be 1000, the default name is the fully qualified class name. Every processor must have a unique name.

    Since:
    2.0.0
    Author:
    Arne Vandamme

    • Method Detail

      • addProcessor

        public void addProcessor(@NonNull
                         @NonNull EntityViewProcessor entityViewProcessor)
        Add a processor to the registry. The name will be the fully qualified class name and the order will be the DEFAULT_ORDER. An exception will be thrown if another processor with that name is already present.
        Parameters:
        entityViewProcessor - processor to add

      • addProcessor

        public void addProcessor(@NonNull
                         @NonNull EntityViewProcessor entityViewProcessor,
                         int order)
        Add a processor with a specific order to the registry. The name will be the fully qualified class name. An exception will be thrown if another processor with that name is already present.
        Parameters:
        entityViewProcessor - processor to add
        order - for the processor

      • addProcessor

        public void addProcessor(String processorName,
                         EntityViewProcessor entityViewProcessor)
        Add a processor with a specific name to the registry. An exception will be thrown if another processor with that name is already present. The order will be the DEFAULT_ORDER.
        Parameters:
        processorName - unique name for the processor
        entityViewProcessor - processor to add

      • addProcessor

        public void addProcessor(String processorName,
                         EntityViewProcessor entityViewProcessor,
                         int order)
        Add a processor with a specific name and order to the registry. An exception will be thrown if another processor with that name is already present.
        Parameters:
        processorName - unique name for the processor
        entityViewProcessor - processor to add
        order - for the processor

      • getProcessors

        public Collection<EntityViewProcessor> getProcessors()
        Returns:
        the list of EntityViewProcessor instances in order

      • getProcessorNames

        public Collection<String> getProcessorNames()
        Returns:
        the list of processor names in order

      • contains

        public boolean contains(String processorName)
        Parameters:
        processorName - name of the processor
        Returns:
        true if a processor with that name is registered

      • remove

        public boolean remove(String processorName)
        Parameters:
        processorName - name of the processor
        Returns:
        true if a processor with that name was present and has been removed, false if it was not present to begin with

      • getProcessorRegistration

        public Optional<EntityViewProcessorRegistry.EntityViewProcessorRegistration> getProcessorRegistration(String processorName)
        Returns:
        the registration record of the processor with that name, allows instant modification of processor value or order

      • getProcessor

        public <T extends EntityViewProcessor> Optional<T> getProcessor(String processorName,
                                                                Class<T> expectedType)
        Get the processor value, expecting it to be of a specific type. If no processor with that name is present, the optional will be empty. If there is a processor but the type is different, a ClassCastException will be thrown instead.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type
        Parameters:
        expectedType - the processor should have
        Returns:
        processor or ClassCastException if not of the expected type

      • dispatch

        public void dispatch(Consumer<EntityViewProcessor> consumer)
        Dispatch a consumer to all processors. This will apply the consumer to all processors in their registration order.
        Parameters:
        consumer - to apply

      • dispatch

        public <U> void dispatch(Consumer<U> consumer,
                         Class<U> processorType)
        Dispatch a consumer to all processors that are of the specific type. This will apply to consumer to all processors that match the required type, in registration order.
        Type Parameters:
        U - processor type
        Parameters:
        consumer - to apply
        processorType - the processors should have
